column4: I have a 250Gb clean hard drive, copletely formatted. What is the best partition scheme for speed. I am also goin to install fedora and Debian and would like all of the distros to share a /home.
sharing /home may not be a good idea, it will share configs too for maybe different versions of the same apps
also some file systems differ on speed handling bigger or smaller files, eg. jfs for big files or reiserfs for small if I remember correctly
5 Gb swap seems very overdone and 20 Gb / is plenty too
